1.name: Payment Classification
1.description: Payment is classified as PI – Payment Instruction, Incoming Direct payment

2.name: Payment Classification
2.description: Payment is classified as SN- Settlement Notification

3.name: Payment Classification
3.description: The payment will continue to Matching Check.

4.name: PI/SN Automatic Matching
4.description: The PI “inherits” the debit account from the SN The SN goes to Complete  Once a PI and an SN match, they are considered as one transaction

5.name: PI/SN Automatic Matching
5.description: PI/SN goes to PAYSET (Payments/Covers) status and  awaits for the arrival of the matching PI/SN.

6.name: Sender Credit Line
6.description: SCL (Sender Credit Line) availablity with the PI sender is checked; If accumulated amount plus the PI amount (converted if necessary) is less than SCL limit for the value date - the customer is credited.  Once SN is received - SCL replenished

7.name: PI/SN Manual Matching
7.description: A user can match PI to SN (and vice versa) manually.

8.name: PI/SN Manual Matching
8.description: User can change the Payment Classification manually by pressing "Not PI/SN' button and the payment will contiue the flow.

9.name: PI/SN Manual Matching
9.description: User can release it by forcing it out of the Q, the customer is credited and the payment will contiue the flow.

10.name: Debit Authorization
10.description: Debit Account is derived successfully and payment continues.

11.name: Debit Authorization
11.description: Debit Account is derived successfully and payment continues.

12.name: Debit Authorization
12.description: The Settlement Account in the Clearing is derived as the Debit Account.

13.name: Debit Authorization
13.description: Debit Account cannot be derived  and payment goes to Repair Q with an error.
